channel.title: Slicing Lists :: Introduction to Python
channel.description: Resources Slides One of the coolest features in Python is the ability to easily create slices of lists. A slice is simply a portion of a list that can be stored and used as a separate list, allowing us as programmers to quickly create and manipulate new lists based on existing lists. There are two basic ways to create a list slice in Python. nums[start:end] - this will create a slice of the list stored in nums that begins at the index start and ends before the index end.
